# Our study

## Does L1 transfer affect Spanish English and Mandarin Chinese speakers' ability to make stress-tense suffix predictions in L2 Spanish? If so, how?

## Does L2 use affect Spanish English and Mandarin Chinese speakers' ability to make stress-tense suffix predictions in L2 Spanish? If so, how?

--
- more use = faster prediction <font size="-1">(Fernández Arroyo et al., under review)</font>

---

# Our study

Participants:
- 30 Spanish monolinguals
- 65 English speakers (L2 Spanish intermediate or above)
- 64 Mandarin Chinese speakers (L2 Spanish intermediate or above)

Materials:
- Language history questionnaire
- Visual world paradigm (eye-tracking)

# Our study

Participants:
- 30 Spanish monolinguals
- 65 English speakers (L2 Spanish intermediate or above)
- 64 Mandarin Chinese speakers (L2 Spanish intermediate or above)

Materials:
- Language history questionnaire
- Visual world paradigm (eye-tracking)

Analysis:
- Growth Curve Analysis <font size="-1">(Mirman, 2014)</font>

```{r eval=FALSE}
eLog ~ 1 + (ot1 + ot2 + ot3) + l1_sum + ot:l1_sum +
    condition_sum + ot1:condition_sum + ot2:condition_sum + 
    use_z + ot1:use_z + ot2:use_z + l1_sum:condition_sum:use_z +
    ot1:l1_sum:condition_sum:use_z + ot2:l1_sum:condition_sum:use_z +
    ot3:l1_sum:condition_sum:use_z +
    (1 + condition_sum + ot1 + ot2 + ot3 | participant) +
    (1 + ot1 + ot2 + ot3 | target)
```

???
A Growth Curve Analysis revealed that: (1) all groups predicted the suffix at the onset of the
second syllable, before hearing it, but that the monolinguals predicted more than the L2 learners;
(2) the English learners predicted more and faster than the Chinese learners; and (3) all the
learners predicted faster the more L2 use they reported, but particularly the Chinese with present
verbs (see Figure 1).

# Discussion

## Does L1 transfer affect Spanish English and Mandarin Chinese speakers' ability to make stress-tense suffix predictions in L2 Spanish? If so, how?

## Does L2 use affect Spanish English and Mandarin Chinese speakers' ability to make stress-tense suffix predictions in L2 Spanish? If so, how?

---

# Discussion

- Adult L2 learners of different L1 can use prosodic cues to predict word endings
- Having an L1 with a more similar stress and verb suffix system and higher L2 use facilitate L2 morphophonological prediction

--

- Amount of L2 use exerts higher influence with in L1-L2 pairs that differ more from each other, suggesting that L2 use may be used to
counteract L1 transfer deficits

---

# Discussioin
These findings support L2 models claiming that language experience with the L1 and the L2 shape L2 processing.
